Required software¶

LAMMPS¶

Required Libraries:

  • MPI (openMPI works best)

  • CUDA

Supported compilers

  • Intel

  • GCC (<=8.2) 2

This will help you compile LAMMPS with ReaxFF and KOKKOS/CUDA. Make sure you have the required library files and headers. This guide does not cover how to do that.

  1. Clone the LAMMPS directory to your home folder:

    cd $HOME
git clone -b stable https://github.com/lammps/lammps.git lammps-stable
cd lammps-stable/src

    Note

    If you dont have git you can download a tarball (140 MB) from https://lammps.sandia.gov/download.html

  2. Install User-Reax/C, MISC, and MANYBODY packages

    make yes-user-reaxc
make yes-misc
make yes-manybody

  3. Create a KOKKOS/CUDA Makefile

    mkdir -p MAKE/MINE
cp MAKE/OPTIONS/Makefile.kokkos_cuda_mpi MAKE/MINE/

  4. Find out the name of your NVIDIA card

    nvidia-smi

  5. Find the CUDA-CC (compute capability) of your card at https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-gpus. For instance, Titan V has CC = 7.0

  6. Edit the Makefile; change KOKKOS_ARCH = Kepler35 to KOKKOS_ARCH = Volta70 or to the CUDA-CC you have

    vim MAKE/MINE/Makefile.kokkos_cuda_mpi

    Note

    For other CUDA CC designations in the MAKEFILE check https://lammps.sandia.gov/doc/Build_extras.html#kokkos or lammps-stable/lib/kokkos/README

  7. Link nvcc-wrapper to $HOME/bin 1

    mkdir $HOME/bin
ln -s $HOME/lammps-stable/lib/kokkos/bin/nvcc_wrapper $HOME/bin

  8. Parallel compile LAMMPS. Change -j4 to the number of processors you want to use

    make -j4 kokkos_cuda_mpi

  9. You should now have an executable lmp_kokkos_cuda_mpi in your LAMMPS src folder. Add this file to your $PATH

    1. create a .local/bin directory

      mkdir -p $HOME/.local/bin
ln -s $HOME/lammps-stable/src/lmp_kokkos_cuda_mpi $HOME/.local/bin/

    2. edit your enviroment file vim $HOME/.bashrc, and add the following line to the end of the file

      PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
export PATH

    3. restart your session or use source $HOME/.bashrc for the change to take effect

OVITO¶

Download and install OVITO from here <https://ovito.org/index.php/download> It is needed to hydroxylate and methylate silica nanowires

Footnotes

1

KOKKOS uses a wrapper to compile LAMMPS files. For some reason it aways looks for this wrapper in $HOME/bin. Something to do with the first two lines in the MAKEFILE. The simplest solution I found is to just link this script to that location

2

If you are using GCC to compile your code with CUDA you cannot use GCC versions >8.2. In which case you must compile a different version of GCC on your machine. An excellent resource on how to do is found here https://bobsteagall.com/2017/12/30/gcc-builder/
